questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An enterprise operations team must monitor all application server traffic in the data center. The team finds that traffic coming from the hub site from R3 and R6 is monitored successfully, but traffic destined to the application server is not monitored. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This is the only one that makes sense as the direction is egress and from the involved router w/c is R4

Selected Answer: C
C is corerct

questions.question_text: Which router attaches the VPN label to incoming packets from CE routing?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is corerct

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer.

choices.A: Add a static route for the 10.1.7.6/32 network.
choices.C: Add the network 10.1.7.6 mask 255.255.255.255 backdoor command.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which action adds the 10.1.7.6/32 route to the BGP table?

discussion.content:
D is correct

by advertising the full match of the loopback Ip address (10.7.6.1/32) as currently its included in the first network advertisement 10.0.0.0 with ? on the right side.

Selected Answer: D
D is corerct

Selected Answer: D
This one looks to be correct. Loopback6 has IP: 10.1.7.6. So adding the network 10.1.7.6 mask 255.255.255.255 command will create an entry in the routing table for 10.1.7.6/32

questions.question_text: A network engineer must configure an EIGRP stub router at a site that advertises only connected and summary routes. Which configuration performs this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B because the eigrp stub command, by default, advertises only connected and summary routes. This meets the requirement.

A allows redistribution of routes.

C only advertises connected routes.

D only advertises summary routes.

Selected Answer: B
B is corerct

Selected Answer: B
Correct. EIGRP Stub Routers advertise only connected and summary routes by default.

choices.C:
ipv6 unicast-routing
ipv6 cef
!
interface Loopback100
ipv6 address 2001:DB8:128::2/128
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0
ipv6 address 2001:DB8:1::2/64
description AS65001 ID B468^AD03G907::1
!
router bgp 65002
no bgp default ipv4-unicast
neighbor 2001:DB8:1::1 remote-as 65001
!
address-family ipv6
network 2001:DB8:128::2/128
neighbor 2001:DB8:1::1 activate
choices.B:
ipv6 unicast-routing
ipv6 cef
!
interface Loopback100
ipv6 address 2001:DB8:128::2/128
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0
ipv6 address 2001:DB8:1::2/64
!
router bgp 65002
no bgp default ipv4-unicast
neighbor 2001:DB8:1::1 remote-as 65001
!
address-family ipv6
network 2001:DB8:128::2/128
choices.A:
ipv6 unicast-routing
ipv6 cef
!
interface Loopback100
ipv6 address 2001:DB8:128::2/128
!

no bgp default ipv4-unicast

!

network 2001:DB8:128::2/128
choices.D:
ipv6 cef
!
interface Loopback100
ipv6 address 2001:DB8:128::2/128
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0
ipv6 address 2001:DB8:1::2/64
!
router bgp 65002
no bgp default ipv4-unicast
neighbor 2001:DB8:1::1 remote-as 65001
!
address-family ipv6
network 2001:DB8:128::2/128
neighbor 2001:DB8:1::1 activate

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct. It is the only option were this below is included.

ipv6 unicast-routing
ipv6 cef
______
______
______
address-family ipv6
network 2001:DB8:128::2/128
neighbor 2001:DB8:1::1 activate

And of course the other commands in option C are correct.
